diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the patient's history of aspiration approximately 10 years prior, the imaging findings showing a high-attenuation lesion in the bronchus intermedius resembling a chicken vertebra, and the presence of empyema and postobstructive pneumonia. The bronchoscopic examination revealed exuberant reactive tissue obstructing the bronchus intermedius, further supporting the diagnosis of chronic foreign body aspiration.
